intro: Rondeletia pansamalana, commonly known as the golden bell, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface.
